Nucleoli are small structures seen in the nucleus. Describes a uniform texture of the nucleus seen in benign cells. Benign cells tend to be grouped in monolayers while cancerous cells are often grouped in multilayers. Those are typically seen in benign tumors. In normal cells the nucleolus is usually very small if visible at all. In cancer cells the nucleoli become more prominent and sometimes there are more of them. Class 0 or 1.
